Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of Tchahorpata
Description: This funerary statuette in green faience was part of the collection Ã‰. de Meester de Ravestein. It is  the name of "the one who knows what is, the prophet" Tchahorpata. The piece is distinguished by a double vertical inscription mentioning the title and the name of the owner. Tchahorpata is known by his anthropomorphic sarcophagus which was found in a tomb of the necropolis of Saqqara and which mentions the year of his death (year 15 of the pharaoh Nectanebo I).
